Neighbourhood Plan Referendums

On Thursday 2 May 2019, as well as electing your local ward councillors, you’ll also be asked to vote on neighbourhood plan for your area. Do you want Torbay Council to use the plans when making decisions on future planning applications? More information is available to help you decide how to vote.

Make 2019 the year you quit smoking for good

Ready to quit smoking this #NoSmokingDay but not sure how to do it? There’s lots of free support available to help you go #Smokefree and give up for good. Get your free Personal Quit Plan and join the thousands of people that have already quit smoking successfully.

Western Corridor Improvements

Find out more about the road improvement works for the Western Corridor project, between Churscombe Cross and Windy Corner. This includes all the latest information on the works at Brixham Road and Windy Corner currently being carried out.

Grinagog presents Minigog

Minigog, a micro version of the popular Grinagog Festival is coming to Torre Abbey’s Spanish Barn and Gardens. There will be family friendly activities during the day, followed by an evening of live music and performances all guaranteed not to disappoint.

Have your say on new town or parish councils in Torbay

We are carrying out a Community Governance Review to decide if any changes should be made to local governance arrangements. This includes setting up new town or parish councils to represent communities and deliver a range of local services. Have your say by Friday 15 March 2019.

Support your local good causes and win up to £25,000

Take part in the Torbay Lottery to support your local good causes.

Your bill, your choice

Did you know that we offer weekly, fortnightly as well as monthly instalment options to pay your Council Tax? If you can’t pay on the day that we have asked you to then contact us to change to a better option for you. If you miss your payment date it will be too late to change.

News

Public Health England launches cervical screening campaign in South West

7 March 2019

On 5 March, Public Health England (PHE) launches a major new campaign in the South West, ‘Cervical Screening Saves Lives’, to increase the number of women attending their cervical screening across the region.

Improvements to the Windy Corner junction starting in March

28 February 2019

The final phase of Torbay Council’s £16.5 million Western Corridor project is due to start on site on Monday 11 March 2019.

Grinagog presents Minigog

25 February 2019

Torbay Council and Continental Drifts are delighted to announce that Minigog, a micro version of Grinagog Festival, will be coming to Torbay this Easter holiday.
More News News RSS Feed
